00001 #include "GridPlugin.h"

00003 GridPlugin::GridPlugin(const QString &name)
00004     : StimPlugin(name), colors(0), vertices(0), nCols(0), nStripes(0)
00005 {}
00006 
00007 GridPlugin::~GridPlugin() { destroyGrid(); }
00008 
00009 void GridPlugin::stop() { StimPlugin::stop(); destroyGrid(); }
00010 
00011 void GridPlugin::destroyGrid() 
00012 {
00013     for ( int i = 0; i < nCols; ++i ) {
00014         delete [] vertices[i];
00015         vertices[i] = 0;
00016     }
00017     for( int i = 0; i < nCols; ++i ){
00018         delete [] colors[i];
00019         colors[i] = 0;
00020     }
00021 
00022     delete [] vertices;
00023     vertices = 0;
00024     delete [] colors;
00025     colors = 0;
00026     nCols = 0;
00027     nStripes = 0;
00028     glDisableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);
00029     glDisableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);
00030 }
00031 
00032 void GridPlugin::setupGrid(int left, int low, int xWidth, int yWidth, int Nx, int Ny)
00033 {
00034         destroyGrid(); // make sure previous grid is gone if any
00035 
00036            // (left, low) is the lower left corner of the grid
00037            // xWidth and yWidth are the side lengths of the rectangles
00038            // Nx and Ny are the number of rectangles in each direction
00039 
00040            // set the class variables
00041            nCols = Nx;
00042            nStripes = Ny;
00043 
00044            // allocate memory in first dimension (x direction) as pointers to hold the memory in the other dimension
00045            // for each x location, a strip of of rectangles will be used
00046            vertices = new GLint*[Nx];
00047            colors = new GLfloat*[Nx];
00048 
00049            // allocate memory in the second dimension (y direction)
00050            for( int i=0; i<Nx; i++ ){
00051                       vertices[i] = new GLint[Ny*4+4+3];
00052                       // vertices[i] is an array of integers for the (i+1)-th strip along the x direction
00053                       // it contains alternating values for x and y coordinates of vertices
00054                       // the first rectangle needs 4 specified vertices
00055                       // every subsequent vertex needs 2 additional vertices
00056                       // thus Ny*4+4 integers are required
00057 
00058                       // set x-coordinates of vertices:
00059                       for( int j=0; j<Ny+1; j++ ){
00060                                  vertices[i][j*4] = left + i*xWidth;
00061                                  vertices[i][j*4+2] = left + (i+1)*xWidth;
00062                       }
00063                       // set y-coordinates of vertices:
00064                       for( int j=0; j<Ny+1; j++ )
00065                                  vertices[i][j*4+1] = vertices[i][j*4+3] = low + j*yWidth;
00066 
00067                       // allocate memory for colors of the vertices
00068                       colors[i] = new GLfloat[Ny*6+6];
00069                       for( int j=0; j<Ny*6+6; j++ )
00070                                  colors[i][j] = 0.5; // set all colors to gray
00071            }
00072 
00073         glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);
00074         glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);
00075 }
00076 
00077 void GridPlugin::drawGrid()  
00078 {
00079     for(int i = 0; i < nCols; ++i) { 
00080         glColorPointer(3, GL_FLOAT, 0, colors[i]);
00081         glVertexPointer(2, GL_INT, 0, vertices[i]);
00082         glDrawArrays(GL_QUAD_STRIP, 0, nStripes*2 + 2);
00083     }
00084 }
